00066 /**
00067 \enum   GEODESY_enumReferenceEllipse
00068 \brief  Enumerated for various reference ellipsoids
00069 
00070 Comma delimited data (copy data below to a text file and rename the extension to .csv for easy 
00071 viewing in an excel spreadsheet for example. \n
00072 GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_AIRY,                         6377563.396, 299.3249647,   6356256.9092444032, 0.00667053999776051,\n  
00073 GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_MODIFED_AIRY,                 6377340.189, 299.3249647,   6356034.4479456525, 0.00667053999776060,\n  
00074 GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_AUSTRALIAN_NATIONAL,          6378160.0,   298.25,        6356774.7191953063, 0.00669454185458760,\n  
00075 GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_BESSEL_1841,                  6377397.155, 299.1528128,   6356078.9628181886, 0.00667437223180205,\n  
00076 GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_CLARKE_1866,                  6378206.4,   294.9786982,   6356583.7999989809, 0.00676865799760959,\n  
00077 GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_CLARKE_1880,                  6378249.145, 293.465,       6356514.8695497755, 0.00680351128284912,\n  
00078 GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_EVEREST_INDIA_1830,           6377276.345, 300.8017,      6356075.4131402392, 0.00663784663019987,\n  
00079 GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_EVEREST_BRUNEI_E_MALAYSIA,    6377298.556, 300.8017,      6356097.5503008962, 0.00663784663019965,\n  
00080 GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_EVEREST_W_MALAYSIA_SINGAPORE, 6377304.063, 300.8017,      6356103.0389931547, 0.00663784663019970,\n  
00081 GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_GRS_1980,                     6378137.0,   298.257222101, 6356752.3141403561, 0.00669438002290069,\n  
00082 GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_HELMERT_1906,                 6378200.0,   298.30,        6356818.1696278909, 0.00669342162296610,\n  
00083 GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_HOUGH_1960,                   6378270.0,   297.00,        6356794.3434343431, 0.00672267002233347,\n  
00084 GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_INTERNATIONAL_1924,           6378388.0,   297.00,        6356911.9461279465, 0.00672267002233323,\n  
00085 GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_SOUTH_AMERICAN_1969,          6378160.0,   298.25,        6356774.7191953063, 0.00669454185458760,\n  
00086 GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_WGS72,                        6378135.0,   298.26,        6356750.5200160937, 0.00669431777826668,\n  
00087 GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_WGS84,                        6378137.0,   298.257223563, 6356752.3142451793, 0.00669437999014132,\n  
00088 */
00089 typedef enum 
00090 {
00091   GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_WGS84 = 0,                         //!< WGS84
00092   GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_AIRY_1830=1,                       //!< Airy 1830
00093   GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_MODIFED_AIRY=2,                    //!< Modified Airy                         
00094   GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_AUSTRALIAN_NATIONAL=3,             //!< Australian National
00095   GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_BESSEL_1841=4,                     //!< Bessel 1841
00096   GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_CLARKE_1866=5,                     //!< Clarke 1866
00097   GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_CLARKE_1880=6,                     //!< Clarke 1880
00098   GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_EVEREST_INDIA_1830=7,              //!< Everest(India 1830)
00099   GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_EVEREST_BRUNEI_E_MALAYSIA=8,       //!< Everest(Brunei & E.Malaysia)
00100   GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_EVEREST_W_MALAYSIA_SINGAPORE=9,    //!< Everest(W.Malaysia & Singapore)
00101   GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_GRS_1980=10,                       //!< Geodetic Reference System 1980
00102   GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_HELMERT_1906=11,                   //!< Helmert 1906
00103   GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_HOUGH_1960=12,                     //!< Hough 1960
00104   GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_INTERNATIONAL_1924=13,             //!< International 1924
00105   GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_SOUTH_AMERICAN_1969=14,            //!< South American 1969
00106   GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_WGS72=15                           //!< World Geodetic System 1972
00107 
00108 } GEODESY_enumReferenceEllipse;
00109

00218 
00219 
00220 /** 
00221 This is a look up table function to get reference ellipse parameters.
00222 \author   Glenn D. MacGougan (GDM)
00223 \date     2005-07-30
00224 \since    2005-07-30
00225 \return   TRUE(1) if successful, FALSE(0) otherwise.
00226 
00227 \b Example \n
00228 \code
00229   double a;      //!< semi-major axis of the reference ellipse                     [m]
00230   double b;      //!< semi-minor axis of the reference ellipse (b = a - a*f_inv)   [m] 
00231   double f_inv;  //!< inverse of the flattening of the reference ellipse           []
00232   double e2;     //!< eccentricity of the reference ellipse (e2 = (a*a-b*b)/(a*a)) [] 
00233   BOOL result;
00234   result = GEODESY_GetReferenceEllipseParameters( GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_WGS84_A, &a, &b, &f_inv, &e2 );
00235   if( result == TRUE )
00236   {
00237     printf( "ellipse = %s\n", GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_STRING_DESCRIPTION[GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_WGS84_A] );
00238     printf( "a       = %20.3f\n", a );
00239     printf( "b       = %20.9f\n", b );
00240     printf( "f_inv   = %20.11f\n", f_inv );
00241     printf( "e2      = %.15f\n\n", e2 );
00242   }
00243 \endcode 
00244 
00245 \b REFERENCES \n
00246 - NovAtel OEM3 reference manual (www.novatel.com).
00247 */
00248 BOOL GEODESY_GetReferenceEllipseParameters( 
00249   const GEODESY_enumReferenceEllipse ellipse, //!< reference ellipse enumerated    []
00250   double* a,      //!< semi-major axis of the reference ellipse                     [m]
00251   double* b,      //!< semi-minor axis of the reference ellipse (b = a - a*f_inv)   [m] 
00252   double* f_inv,  //!< inverse of the flattening of the reference ellipse           []
00253   double* e2      //!< eccentricity of the reference ellipse (e2 = (a*a-b*b)/(a*a)) [] 
00254   );
00255 
00256 
00257 
00258 /**
00259 This function converts curvilinear geodetic coordinates from latitude, longitude, 
00260 and ellipsoidal height to cartesian geodetic coordinates x, y, and z for the 
00261 reference ellipse specified. 
00262 (e.g. GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_WGS84).
00263 
00264 \author   Glenn D. MacGougan (GDM)
00265 \date     2005-07-30
00266 \since    2005-07-30
00267 \return   TRUE(1) if successful, FALSE(0) otherwise.
00268 
00269 \b Example \n
00270 \code
00271   double latitude=0;   //!< geodetic latitude                [rad]
00272   double longitude=0;  //!< geodetic longitude               [rad]
00273   double height=0;     //!< geodetic height                  [m]
00274   double x;            //!< earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00275   double y;            //!< earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00276   double z;            //!< earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00277 
00278   result = GEODESY_ConvertGeodeticCurvilinearToEarthFixedCartesianCoordinates(
00279     GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_WGS84_A,
00280     latitude, 
00281     longitude,
00282     height,   
00283     &x,       
00284     &y,       
00285     &z        
00286     );
00287   printf( "ellipse   = %s\n", GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_STRING_DESCRIPTION[GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_WGS84_A] );
00288   printf( "latitude  = %.12lf\n", latitude );
00289   printf( "longitude = %.12lf\n", longitude );
00290   printf( "height    = %.4lf\n", height );
00291   printf( "x         = %.4lf\n", x );
00292   printf( "y         = %.4lf\n", y );
00293   printf( "z         = %.4lf\n\n", z );
00294 \endcode
00295 
00296 \b REFERENCES \n
00297 - Schwartz, K. P. (1997). ENGO 421 Lecture Notes - Fundamentals of Geodesy. 
00298   Chapter 3, pp. 33-66 & Appendix B, pp. 178-183. Geomatics Engineering, 
00299   University of Calgary.\n
00300 */
00301 BOOL GEODESY_ConvertGeodeticCurvilinearToEarthFixedCartesianCoordinates(
00302   const GEODESY_enumReferenceEllipse  referenceEllipse,  //!< reference ellipse enumerated []
00303   const double latitude,   //!< geodetic latitude                [rad]
00304   const double longitude,  //!< geodetic longitude               [rad]
00305   const double height,     //!< geodetic height                  [m]
00306   double *x,               //!< earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00307   double *y,               //!< earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00308   double *z                //!< earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00309   );
00310 
00311 /**
00312 This function converts cartesian geodetic coordinates from x, y, and z to 
00313 curvilinear geodetic coordinates latitude, longitude, and ellipsoidal 
00314 height for the reference ellipse specified. An iterative approach is used.
00315 (e.g. GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_WGS84).
00316 
00317 \author   Glenn D. MacGougan (GDM)
00318 \date     2005-07-30
00319 \since    2005-07-30
00320 \return   TRUE(1) if successful, FALSE(0) otherwise.
00321 
00322 \remarks
00323 (1) Hsu (1992) shows that the iterative form is slightly faster than the closed form for 3 iterations. \n
00324 (2) Testing by GDM for WGS84, all points lat = -90:1:90 and lon = -180:1:180 were tested
00325    lat, lon, hgt first converted to x, y, z then converted back to lat ,lon, hgt and the number of
00326    iterations noted. No errors observed. 2-5 iterations are needed with a mean of 4.32 iterations. \n
00327 
00328 \b REFERENCES \n
00329 - Schwartz, K. P. (1997). ENGO 421 Lecture Notes - Fundamentals of Geodesy. 
00330   Chapter 3, pp. 33-66 & Appendix B, pp. 178-183. Geomatics Engineering, 
00331   University of Calgary. \n
00332   Iterative Method - Chapter 3, pp. 33-66.
00333   Closed Form      - Appendix B, pp. 178-183. \n
00334 - Hsu, David Y. (1992). Closed Form Solution for Geodetic Coordinate 
00335   Transformation. ION NTM 1992. pp. 397-400. \n
00336 - Misra, Pratap & Per Enge (2004). Global Positioning System Signals 
00337   Measurements and Performance. Ganga-Jamuna Press. 
00338   ISBN 0-9709544-0-9. PP. 115-116. \n
00339 */
00340 BOOL GEODESY_ConvertEarthFixedCartesianToGeodeticCurvilinearCoordinates(
00341   const GEODESY_enumReferenceEllipse  referenceEllipse,  //!< reference ellipse enumerated []
00342   const double x,              // earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00343   const double y,              // earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]
00344   const double z,              // earth fixed cartesian coordinate [m]  
00345   double *latitude,            // geodetic latitude                [rad]
00346   double *longitude,           // geodetic longitude               [rad]
00347   double *height               // geodetic height                  [m]
00348   );
00349 
00350 
00351 /**
00352 Given a reference point (datum) for a local geodetic coordinate system
00353 compute northing easting and vertical of another point given its latitude,
00354 longitude, and height for the reference ellipse specified.
00355 (e.g. GEODESY_REFERENCE_ELLIPSE_WGS84).
00356 
00357 \author   Glenn D. MacGougan (GDM)
00358 \date     2005-07-30
00359 \since    2005-07-30
00360 \return   TRUE(1) if successful, FALSE(0) otherwise.
00361 
00362 \b REFERENCES \n
00363 [1] Schwartz, K. P. (1997). ENGO 421 Lecture Notes - Fundamentals of Geodesy. 
00364    Chapter 4, pp 79. \n
00365 */
00366 BOOL GEODESY_ComputeNorthingEastingVertical(
00367   const GEODESY_enumReferenceEllipse  referenceEllipse,  //!< reference ellipse enumerated []
00368   const double referenceLatitude,  //!< datum geodetic latitude  [rad]
00369   const double referenceLongitude, //!< datum geodetic longitude [rad]
00370   const double referenceHeight,    //!< datum geodetic height    [m]
00371   const double latitude,           //!< geodetic latitude        [rad]
00372   const double longitude,          //!< geodetic longitude       [rad]
00373   const double height,             //!< geodetic height          [m]
00374   double *northing,                //!< local geodetic northing  [m]
00375   double *easting,                 //!< local geodetic easting   [m]
00376   double *vertical                 //!< local geodetic vertical  [m]
00377   );

00381 /*
00382 Compute the difference between two points in a local geodetic frame
00383 using one point as the reference. Can be used to compute position error 
00384 with respect to a known reference but keep in mind a local geodetic 
00385 frame is used.
00386  
00387 \author   Glenn D. MacGougan (GDM)
00388 \date     2005-07-30
00389 \since    2005-07-30
00390 \return   TRUE(1) if successful, FALSE(0) otherwise.
00391 
00392 \b REFERENCES \n
00393 \see GEODESY_ComputeNorthingEastingVertical
00394 */
00395 BOOL GEODESY_ComputePositionDifference(
00396   const GEODESY_enumReferenceEllipse  referenceEllipse,  //!< reference ellipse enumerated []
00397   const double referenceLatitude,  //!< reference point geodetic latitude  [rad]
00398   const double referenceLongitude, //!< reference point geodetic longitude [rad]
00399   const double referenceHeight,    //!< reference point geodetic height    [m]
00400   const double latitude,           //!< geodetic latitude        [rad]
00401   const double longitude,          //!< geodetic longitude       [rad]
00402   const double height,             //!< geodetic height          [m]
00403   double *difference_northing,     //!< difference in northing   [m]  (+2 m, means 2 m North of the reference)
00404   double *difference_easting,      //!< difference in easting    [m]  (+2 m, means 2 m East  of the reference)
00405   double *difference_vertical      //!< difference in vertical   [m]  (+2 m, means 2 m above of the reference)
00406   );

00422   Chapter 3, pp. 33-66 & Appendix B, pp. 178-183. Geomatics Engineering, 
00423   University of Calgary. \n

00429   );

00496 /**
00497 Rotates a vector from a Local Geodetic Frame (LG) to and Earth Centered Earth Fixed Frame (ECEF).
00498  
00499 \author   Glenn D. MacGougan (GDM)
00500 \date     2005-07-30
00501 \since    2005-07-30
00502 \return   TRUE(1) if successful, FALSE(0) otherwise.
00503 
00504 \b REFERENCES \n
00505 - Schwartz, K. P. (1997). ENGO 421 Lecture Notes - Fundamentals of Geodesy. 
00506   Chapter 3, pp. 33-66 & Appendix B, pp. 178-183. Geomatics Engineering, 
00507   University of Calgary. \n
00508 */ 
00509 BOOL GEODESY_RotateVectorFromLocalGeodeticFrameToEarthFixedFrame(
00510   const double referenceLatitude,  //!< reference geodetic latitude                 [rad]
00511   const double referenceLongitude, //!< reference geodetic longitude                [rad]
00512   const double dN,                 //!< local geodetic northing vector component    [m]
00513   const double dE,                 //!< local geodetic easting  vector component    [m]
00514   const double dUp,                //!< local geodetic vertical vector component    [m]
00515   double* dX,                      //!< earth centered earth fixed vector component [m]
00516   double* dY,                      //!< earth centered earth fixed vector component [m]
00517   double* dZ                       //!< earth centered earth fixed vector component [m]
00518   );
00519 
00520 /**
00521 Rotates a vector from a Earth Centered Earth Fixed Frame (ECEF) to a Local Geodetic Frame (LG).
00522  
00523 \author   Glenn D. MacGougan (GDM)
00524 \date     2005-07-30
00525 \since    2005-07-30
00526 \return   TRUE(1) if successful, FALSE(0) otherwise.
00527 
00528 \b REFERENCES \n
00529 - Schwartz, K. P. (1997). ENGO 421 Lecture Notes - Fundamentals of Geodesy. 
00530   Chapter 3, pp. 33-66 & Appendix B, pp. 178-183. Geomatics Engineering, 
00531   University of Calgary. \n
00532 */ 
00533 BOOL GEODESY_RotateVectorFromEarthFixedFrameToLocalGeodeticFrame(
00534   const double referenceLatitude,  //!< reference geodetic latitude                 [rad]
00535   const double referenceLongitude, //!< reference geodetic longitude                [rad]
00536   const double dX,                 //!< earth centered earth fixed vector component [m]
00537   const double dY,                 //!< earth centered earth fixed vector component [m]
00538   const double dZ,                 //!< earth centered earth fixed vector component [m]
00539   double* dN,                      //!< local geodetic northing vector component    [m]
00540   double* dE,                      //!< local geodetic easting  vector component    [m]
00541   double* dUp                      //!< local geodetic vertical vector component    [m]
00542   );

00544 /**
00545 Computes the azimuth and elevation angles in the local geodetic (LG) frame between the 'from' 
00546 point to the 'to' point given these point in the earth fixed frame. 
00547 e.g. between a user gps location (from) and a satellite (to).
00548  
00549 \author   Glenn D. MacGougan (GDM)
00550 \date     2005-07-30
00551 \since    2005-07-30 
00552 \return   TRUE(1) if successful, FALSE(0) otherwise.
00553  */
00554 BOOL GEODESY_ComputeAzimuthAndElevationAnglesBetweenToPointsInTheEarthFixedFrame(
00555   const GEODESY_enumReferenceEllipse  referenceEllipse, //!< reference ellipse enumerated []
00556   const double fromX, //!< earth centered earth fixed vector from point X component [m]
00557   const double fromY, //!< earth centered earth fixed vector from point Y component [m]
00558   const double fromZ, //!< earth centered earth fixed vector from point Z component [m]
00559   const double toX,   //!< earth centered earth fixed vector to point X component   [m]
00560   const double toY,   //!< earth centered earth fixed vector to point Y component   [m]
00561   const double toZ,   //!< earth centered earth fixed vector to point Z component   [m]
00562   double* elevation,  //!< elevation angle [rad]
00563   double* azimuth     //!< azimuth angle   [rad]
00564   );
